name: Anticheat
body:
### AntiCheat
AntiCheat helps server admins easily identify and block malicious users by monitoring and analyzing the behaviour of their players.

### Installation
1. Download the [latest release build](http://api.bukget.org/2/bukkit/plugin/anticheat/latest/download).
2. Drag AntiCheat.jar into your Bukkit server's plugins folder
3. **You're done!** Optionally, explore the configuration and customize to your liking.

### Compiling
1. Ensure you have the [JDK](http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html), [Git](http://git-scm.com/), and [Maven3](http://maven.apache.org/download.cgi) installed.
2. ```$ git clone git@github.com:h31ix/AntiCheat.git```
3. ```$ cd AntiCheat```
4. ```$ mvn clean install```

### Support
Having trouble? Check out the documentation at http://dev.bukkit.org/bukkit-plugins/anticheat/ as well as the [Q&A](http://dev.bukkit.org/server-mods/anticheat/pages/q-a/) and [information](http://dev.bukkit.org/bukkit-plugins/anticheat/pages/information-how-to-use/) pages. If you don't find what you're looking for, feel free to join us on IRC (#anticheat on irc.esper.net) or [file a bug report](https://github.com/h31ix/AntiCheat/issues).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
